member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfChart.XForms.ChartTooltipBehavior
member.summary: ChartTooltipBehavior enables you to display any information over a ChartSeries.
member.remarks:
It is used in conjunction with the pointer. It appears when touch down over any chart segment. It is set to display the metadata of the particular segment or data point.
By default, a small box containing the data pointï¿½s y values are displayed as the ToolTip. The y values vary depending on the ChartSeries. For example, a single y value is usually displayed in Column and BarSeries. In the FinancialSeries, high, low, open, and close values are displayed in ToolTip.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfChart.XForms.StepLineSeries
member.summary: A step line chart uses vertical and horizontal lines to connect the data points in a series forming a step-like progression. Step line charts are preferred over line charts in such cases because they form a step-like structure and bring out the intermittent pattern (the rise and fall in data) better.
